TARGET: MICROS Systems, Inc. 
BUYER: Oracle Corp. 
SELLER: MICROS Systems, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: January 13, 2016 
ANNOUNCE DATE: June 23, 2014 
EFFECTIVE DATE: September 8, 2014



DEAL NO.: 791488


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition Tender Offer

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

September 8, 2014

Attitude:

Friendly

Source of Funds:

Cash, Bank Debt

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp, acquired MICROS Systems Inc for, US$5.1 billion in cash. Under the terms of the agreement, Oracle Corp paid US$68 in cash per MICROS Systems share. The transaction extends the offerings of Oracle into the Hospitality and Retail industries. The transaction was originally expected to close in the second half of 2014, and was subject to certain closing conditions including majority shareholders of MICROS Systems tendering their shares, regulatory approvals and other customary closing conditions. The deal is expected to be accretive to the earnings of Oracle Corp. Originally on June 17, 2014, Oracle Corp was rumored to be interested in acquiring MICROS Systems Inc for a reported value that could reach up to more than US$5 billion. The transaction enables Oracle Corp to expand its product portfolio in the hotels and restaurants software industry. On June 23, 2014, according to reports, Oracle Corp was nearing a deal to acquire MICROS Systems. The transaction was expected to be announced in the following days. On July 29, 2014, the expiration of the deal previously scheduled on July 31, 2014 has been extended until August 15, 2014. On August 13, 2014, the offer period has been further extended from August 15, 2014 to September 2, 2014. As of August 29, 2014, the transaction received approval from the European Commission. On September 3, 2014, the offer period has expired with approximately 82.8% of the target's outstanding shares or a total of 62,093,103 shares tendered. Furthermore, each remaining share of MICROS Systems that is not validly tendered during the offer period will be converted into the right to receive the same amount of US$68 cash per share. Following the completion, the target will no longer trade and will become a wholly-owned subsidiary of Oracle Corp. Moreover, Oracle Corp announced that they commenced a subsequent offer period that will close on September 5, 2014, unless extended. On September 8, 2014, Oracle Corp announced the completion of the offer. Based in the United States, MICROS Systems Inc develops and provides enterprise information solutions for the global hospitality industry.

Premium Offered:

.178

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Share Price:

$68.000000

Closing Offer Price:

$5,000,000,000

Price/Earnings:

30.286

Multiple of Book Value:

7.919

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

$5,087,580,684

Total Invested Capital:

$5,087,581,000

Base Equity Price:

$5,087,580,684

Seller Breakup Fee:

$157,780,000

TARGET: Stellent, Inc. 
BUYER: Oracle Corp. 
SELLER: Stellent, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: May 11, 2009 
ANNOUNCE DATE: November 2, 2006 
EFFECTIVE DATE: December 14, 2006



DEAL NO.: 397154


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition Tender Offer

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

December 14, 2006

Attitude:

Friendly

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired Stellent Inc through a tender offer for approximately $404.9 million in cash. According to the terms of the agreement, Oracle Corp is offering $13.50 per share in cash for all the outstanding shares of Stellent Inc. Stellent Inc's board of directors has approved of the agreement and unanimously recommends that its shareholders accept Oracle Corp's offer. The acquisition is expected to complement and extend Oracle Corp's existing content management solution portfolio. Stellent Inc develops content management software solutions for more than 4,700 customers worldwide including The Home Depot, Merrill Lynch, and Vodafone.

Transaction Notes:

Be = 29,999,426 o/s of STEL * $13.50 per share cash offer

TARGET: Agile Software Corp. 
BUYER: Oracle Corp. 
SELLER: Agile Software Corp.



LAST UPDATE: March 5, 2013 
ANNOUNCE DATE: May 15, 2007 
EFFECTIVE DATE: July 16, 2007



DEAL NO.: 422261


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 16, 2007

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired Agile Software Corp for approximately $463.6 million in stock. According to the terms of the agreement, Oracle Corp will acquire all of the outstanding common shares of Agile Software Corp for $8.10 per share in cash. The acquisition will serve as the foundation of Oracle Corp's product lifecycle management offering and will further Oracle Corp's strategy of delivering industry-specific enterprise applications. San Jose, California-based Agile Software Corp develops product lifecycle management software solutions for over 1,250 customers globally.

Transaction Notes:

BE = 57,239,759 o/s of AGIL * $8.10 per share in cash

TARGET: RightNow Technologies, Inc. 
BUYER: Oracle Corp. 
SELLER: RightNow Technologies, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: April 30, 2013 
ANNOUNCE DATE: October 24, 2011 
EFFECTIVE DATE: January 25, 2012



DEAL NO.: 604154


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

January 25, 2012

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired RightNow Technologies Inc for US$1.4 billion in cash. Under the terms of the agreement, Oracle Corp paid US$43 per share. The acquisition would allow Oracle Corp to expand its product portfolio and services offerings. The deal was approved by the Board of Directors of RightNow Technologies Inc. The transaction was subject to approvals from the shareholders of RightNow Technologies Inc and regulatory authorities. The deal was expected to close in early 2012. Based in Bozeman, Montana, RightNow Technologies Inc provides customer relationship management software and services. On December 8, 2011, the transaction received clearance from the Austrian Competition Authority. On December 22, 2011, RightNow announced that its shareholders voted in favor of the acquisition of the company by Oracle Corp.

Transaction Notes:

BE = US$43 cash per share * 33,063,806 target shares o/s as of October 28, 2011.

Premium Offered:

.105

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Share Price:

$1,421,744,000

53.405

42.956

Cash

$1,421,743,658

TARGET: Compendium Software LLC 
BUYER: Oracle Corp. 
SELLER: Compendium Software LLC



LAST UPDATE: October 18, 2013 
ANNOUNCE DATE: October 17, 2013 
EFFECTIVE DATE: October 17, 2013



DEAL NO.: 768116


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

October 17, 2013

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired Compendium Software LLC for an undisclosed amount. The addition of Compendium Software LLC's marketing platform to Oracle Corp will further add customers, and generate more revenue. Compendium Software LLC's innovative solution complements Oracle Corp's industry leading Eloqua Marketing Cloud which is a part of Oracle Corp's comprehensive Customer Experience solution. The transaction will automate content delivery across different channels. Compendium Software LLC is located in Indianapolis, Indiana, United States and develops and provides content marketing software solutions.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

Compendium Software LLC

Country:

United States

Industry:

Computer Software, Supplies & Services

Description:

Develops and provides content marketing software solutions

FOCUS - 6 of 146 DOCUMENTS


Copyright 2016 FactSet Mergerstat, LLC 
Mergerstat M & A Database



TARGET: Acme Packet, Inc. 
BUYER: Oracle Corp. 
SELLER: Acme Packet, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: January 5, 2016 
ANNOUNCE DATE: February 4, 2013 
EFFECTIVE DATE: March 28, 2013



DEAL NO.: 746558


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 28, 2013

Attitude:

Friendly

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired Acme Packet Inc for US$2 billion in cash. Under the terms of transaction, Oracle Corp paid US$29.25 in cash per share of Acme Packet Inc. The transaction was in line with Oracle Corp's growth strategy by enhancing its communication portfolio and expanding its IP communications networks across the globe. The acquisition was subject to customary closing conditions including stockholders approval and certain regulatory approvals. Following the completion of the deal, the management team and all of the employees of Acme Packet Inc will join Oracle Corp's Communication Global Business Unit. The Board of Directors of Acme Packet Inc unanimously approved the transaction. Acme Packet Inc is located in Bedford, Massachusetts, United States and manufactures communications equipment designed to route voice and data over internet protocol networks. The transaction was originally expected to close in the first half of 2013.

Transaction Notes:

BE = US$29.25 cash per share * 67,446,202 Acme Packet Inc o/s.

DEAL NO.: 88686


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition Management Buyout. Leveraged buyout.

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Financial

Closing Date:

August 1, 1995

Deal Description:

Division of Oracle, information software company, which provides services to local authorities and housing associations in the UK, has been taken over by its Manchester based management. Oracles previous general manager of local government, John Walsh, is managing director of the new company, First Software, which will continue to develop Oracle based applications and provide consultancy and training services to local authorities and housing associations.

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: Hyperion Solutions Corp. 
BUYER: Oracle Corp. 
SELLER: Hyperion Solutions Corp.



LAST UPDATE: October 20, 2008 
ANNOUNCE DATE: March 1, 2007 
EFFECTIVE DATE: April 19, 2007



DEAL NO.: 412871


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition Tender Offer

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

April 19, 2007

Attitude:

Neutral

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp has acquired Hyperion Solutions Corp, via a cash tender offer, for approximately US$3.1 billion in cash. Under the terms of the transaction, Oracle Corp paid US$52 for each outstanding share of Hyperion Solutions Corp. The purchase price represents about a 21% premium over Hyperion Solutions Corp's February 28, 2007 close price of US$42.84. With its best-in-class performance management software, Hyperion Solutions Corp has over 12,000 customers worldwide, including 91 of the Fortune 100. With the acquisition, Oracle Corp will extend its business intelligence product strategy to offer the most comprehensive system for enterprise performance management.

Transaction Notes:

BE = 59,178,935 HYSL shares outstanding * US$52.00 ORCL offer

TARGET: i-flex Solutions Ltd. 
BUYER: Oracle Corp. / Oracle Global (Mauritius) Ltd. 
SELLER: i-flex Solutions Ltd.



LAST UPDATE: December 3, 2008 
ANNOUNCE DATE: September 13, 2006 
EFFECTIVE DATE: January 6, 2007



DEAL NO.: 389217


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition Tender Offer

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Amendment Date:

December 7, 2006

Closing Date:

January 6, 2007

Attitude:

Neutral

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Due to a recent acquisition of shares issued on a preferential basis, Oracle Corp commenced a mandatory tender offer and acquired an additional 25.92% stake in i-flex Solutions Ltd, based in Mumbai, India, for approximately INR48.1 billion (US$1.1 billion) in cash. Under the terms of offer, Oracle Corp, through its subsidiary Oracle Global (Mauritius) Ltd, will acquire 23,000,000 shares in i-flex Solutions Ltd at INR2,100 (US$47) per share. The bidder increased its offer on December 8, 2006. The opening date of the offer is expected to be December 4, 2006, and close on December 23, 2006. i-flex Solutions Ltd provides software solutions and services. After completion, Oracle Corp's stake increased to 81.02% in i-flex Solutions Ltd. DSP Merrill Lynch is the manager to the offer.

Transaction Notes:

BE = 23,000,000 i-flex ordinary shares * INR2,100 per share cash offer.

LAST UPDATE: May 11, 2009 
ANNOUNCE DATE: October 23, 2006 
EFFECTIVE DATE: December 15, 2006



DEAL NO.: 395375


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

December 15, 2006

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired MetaSolv Inc for approximately US$213.6 million in cash. Under the terms of agreement, Oracle Corp will pay US$4.10 for each outstanding share of MetaSolv Inc. This price represents about a 23% premium over MetaSolv Inc's close price of US$3.32 on October 20, 2006. According to the press release, Oracle Corp will now offer "a fully integrated, end-to-end productized solution that will help service providers streamline the 'campaign to cash' process, optimize asset lifecycles and accelerate time-to-market of new products and services."

Transaction Notes:

TARGET: BEA Systems, Inc.

ANNOUNCE DATE: January 16, 2008 
EFFECTIVE DATE: April 29, 2008



DEAL NO.: 454877


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

April 29, 2008

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired BEA Systems Inc for US$8.0 billion in cash. Under the terms of the agreement, Oracle Corp paid US$19.375 for each share of BEA Systems Inc. This represents about a 24% premium over BEA Systems Inc's January 17, 2008 close price of US$15.58. This agreement comes after a failed attempt by Oracle Corp to acquire BEA Systems Inc for US$17 per share in October 2007. BEA Systems Inc is a developer of enterprise infrastructure software.

Transaction Notes:

TARGET: BEA Systems, Inc. 
BUYER: Oracle Corp. 
SELLER: BEA Systems, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: July 30, 2010 
ANNOUNCE DATE: October 12, 2007



DEAL NO.: 443096


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Cancelled Date:

October 28, 2007

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp's proposal to acquire BEA Systems Inc for US$6.7 billion in cash has expired. Oracle Corp was offering to acquire each share of BEA Systems Inc for US$17. This represented about a 25% premium over BEA Systems Inc's October 11, 2007 close price of US$13.62. Based in San Jose, California, BEA Systems Inc provides enterprise application and service infrastructure software worldwide. The acquisition of BEA Systems Inc would have allowed Oracle Corp to increase its engineering resources.

Transaction Notes:

BE = 398,272,000 BEAS shares outstanding * US$17 cash

Premium Offered:

.213

Percent Sought:

100.000%

TARGET: Datanomic Ltd. 
BUYER: Oracle Corp. 
SELLER: Datanomic Ltd.



LAST UPDATE: June 30, 2011 
ANNOUNCE DATE: April 18, 2011 
EFFECTIVE DATE: June 20, 2011



DEAL NO.: 583476


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 20, 2011

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired Datanomic Ltd, a portfolio company of DN Capital Ltd and SVB Capital, for an undisclosed amount. The purpose of the acquisition was to reduce the cost and complexity of data management across Oracle Corp's customers' businesses. Following the acquisition, the management and employees of Datanomic Ltd will transfer to Oracle Corp. The transaction was originally expected to close in the first half of the calendar year of 2011. Founded in 2001 and based in Cambridge, East Anglia, Datanomic Ltd develops software and provides data management services.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: Retek, Inc. 
BUYER: Oracle Corp. 
SELLER: Retek, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: January 31, 2012 
ANNOUNCE DATE: March 8, 2005 
EFFECTIVE DATE: April 12, 2005



DEAL NO.: 330527


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition Tender Offer

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Amendment Date:

March 21, 2005

Closing Date:

April 12, 2005

Attitude:

Friendly

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired the remaining 90.2% stake in Retek Inc it does not already own for US$569.4 million in cash. Oracle Corp raised its offer of US$9 to US$11.25 per share for every Retek Inc share held after SAP increased its bid from US$8.50 to US$11.00. Retek Inc develops business to business software solutions. Oracle Corp and Retek Inc have been working together since 1986. According to the press release issued by Oracle, 80% of Retek's customers currently run Oracle's infrastructure software. Retek Inc had revenue of US$174.2 million in 2004.

Transaction Notes:

BE = 50,618,111 o/s RETK not owned * US$11.25 per share cash offer. competing bid #329544.Price update, 3/21.

TARGET: Amberpoint, Inc. 
BUYER: Oracle Corp. 
SELLER: Amberpoint, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: November 23, 2012 
ANNOUNCE DATE: February 8, 2010 
EFFECTIVE DATE: February 8, 2010



DEAL NO.: 535948


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

February 8, 2010

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired Amberpoint Inc for an undisclosed sum. The transaction strengthens the capabilities of the solutions offered by Oracle Corp while it provides Oracle Corp's customers with a comprehensive offering that improves performance and reduce IT costs. Amberpoint, Inc is an Oakland-based provider of software solutions which specialize in Service-Oriented Architecture (SOA) Management. It is a portfolio company of Crosslink Capital Ventures, Motorola Ventures, Meritech Capital Partners, Norwest Venture Partners, SAP Ventures, and Sutter Hill Ventures. The transaction was originally expected to close in the first half of 2010.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Provides prepackaged software services

TARGET: Pillar Data Systems, Inc. 
BUYER: Oracle Corp. 
SELLER: Pillar Data Systems, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: March 25, 2013 
ANNOUNCE DATE: June 29, 2011 
EFFECTIVE DATE: July 18, 2011



DEAL NO.: 591227


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 18, 2011

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired Pillar Data Systems Inc from Oracle Corp's CEO Larry Ellison for an undisclosed amount in earn-outs. The acquisition allows Oracle Corp to strengthen its position in the market. The transaction was expected to be completed in July 2011. Pillar Data Systems Inc is based in San Jose, California, United States, and develops network storage systems. Pillar Data Systems Inc serves around 600 customers.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Contingent Payment Amount:

$-999,000,000

TARGET: Tekelec, Inc. 
BUYER: Oracle Corp. 
SELLER: Tekelec, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: April 9, 2013 
ANNOUNCE DATE: March 25, 2013



DEAL NO.: 750763


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp agreed to acquire Tekelec Inc from SIRIS Capital Group LLC and other shareholders for an undisclosed amount. Other sellers in the transaction include GSO Capital Partners LP, Sankaty Advisors LLC and ZelnickMedia Corp. The transaction enhances Oracle Corp's portfolio of mobile broadband solutions and expands its service offerings. Until the acquisition closes, Oracle Corp and Tekelec Inc will continue to operate independently. Tekelec Inc is located in Morrisville, North Carolina, United States and provides mobile broadband solutions. The transaction is subject to customary closing conditions and approvals.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

United States

NASDAQ

Provides mobile broadband solutions

Mergerstat M & A Database



TARGET: PeopleSoft, Inc. 
BUYER: Oracle Corp. 
SELLER: PeopleSoft, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: June 26, 2013 
ANNOUNCE DATE: June 6, 2003 
EFFECTIVE DATE: January 7, 2005



DEAL NO.: 200158


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition Tender Offer

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Amendment Date:

December 13, 2004

Closing Date:

January 7, 2005

Attitude:

Hostile

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired PeopleSoft Inc for US$9.9 billion in cash. The agreement comes even after PeopleSoft has completed its acquisition of JD Edwards & Co. Oracle increased its November 1, 2004 cash tender offer from US$24 to US$26.50 per share. Oracle had raised its offer from its original offer of about $5.1 billion, its second offer of about $6.2 billion, and its third offer of approximately $7.3 billion. The revised offer is to reflect changes in market conditions and in PeopleSoft's market valuation.The tender offer made by Oracle was considered hostile as PeopleSoft already rejected the bid and recommended that shareholders not to tender their shares, citing anti-trust concerns with the combination of the two companies. Larry Ellison, the chairman and chief executive officer of Oracle Corp commented that the acquisition of PeopleSoft Inc would have immediately made Oracle Corp an even more profitable and competitive company in the software market.

Transaction Notes:

BE=$26.50 cash x 375,746,417 PSFT o/s.

Premium Offered:

.617

Percent Sought:

100.000%

$26.500000

$6,011,943,000

$9,957,280,000

$200,000,000

TARGET: SelectMinds, Inc. 
BUYER: Oracle Corp. 
SELLER: SelectMinds, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: September 17, 2013 
ANNOUNCE DATE: September 17, 2012 
EFFECTIVE DATE: October 25, 2012



DEAL NO.: 733097


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

October 25, 2012

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired SelectMinds Inc for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition enables Oracle Corp to improve its human resource and employee management applications. Following the transaction, SelectMinds Inc's team would join Oracle Corp. The transaction was subject to customary closing condition and approvals, and was originally expected to close by the second half of 2012. SelectMinds Inc is located in New York, United States, and provides corporate social networking solutions.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: Nimbula, Inc. 
BUYER: Oracle Corp. 
SELLER: Nimbula, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: January 1, 2014 
ANNOUNCE DATE: March 13, 2013 
EFFECTIVE DATE: March 13, 2013



DEAL NO.: 749826


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 13, 2013

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired Nimbula Inc, a portfolio company of Sequoia Capital and Accel Partners LLC, for an undisclosed amount. The transaction was reported to be valued at US$100 million. The transaction enhances Oracle Corp's portfolio of cloud computing software solutions. The deal was expected to be accretive to the annual revenue of Oracle Corp for the year 2013. The transaction was originally expected to be completed in the first half of 2013. Nimbula Inc is located in Mountain View, California, United States and provides comprehensive cloud operating systems.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

$100,000,000

Terms:

Cash

$100,000,000

$100,000,000

TARGET: Responsys, Inc. 
BUYER: Oracle Corp. 
SELLER: Responsys, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: July 9, 2014 
ANNOUNCE DATE: December 20, 2013 
EFFECTIVE DATE: February 6, 2014



DEAL NO.: 774483


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition Tender Offer

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

February 6, 2014

Attitude:

Friendly

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired Responsys Inc for US$1.4 billion in cash, by way of a tender offer. Under the terms of the transaction, Oracle Corp paid US$27 in cash in exchange for each share in Responsys Inc. The transaction further expands Oracle Corp's Customer Experience Cloud software, including categories under commerce, sales, service, and support. The transaction was unanimously approved by the Board of Directors of Responsys Inc; as such, the shareholders of Responsys Inc were advised to vote in favor of the tender offer. The transaction was subject to the approval of at least a majority of Responsys Inc's shareholders, approval of regulatory bodies including the expiration of the waiting period under the Hart-Scott-Rodino Antitrust Improvements Act of 1976, and fulfillment of other customary closing conditions. The transaction was expected to close in the first half of 2014. Founded in 1998, Responsys Inc is located in San Bruno, California, United States and provides email and cross-channel marketing solutions. On February 5, 2014, the offer period expired with 41,588,443 shares, or 79% of Responsys Inc, were tendered. Accordingly, the minimum offer condition was completed, and all shares were was converted into the right to receive the cash consideration.

Premium Offered:

.398

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Share Price:

$27.000000

Closing Offer Price:

$1,400,512,000

Price/Earnings:

1,779.558

9.212

Terms:

Available

Cash

$1,400,512,410

$1,400,965,000

Base Equity Price:

$1,400,512,410

$57,400,002

Mergerstat M & A Database



TARGET: LiveLOOK LLC 
BUYER: Oracle Corp. 
SELLER: Edison Innovation



LAST UPDATE: June 20, 2014 
ANNOUNCE DATE: June 20, 2014



DEAL NO.: 791844


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp agreed to acquire LiveLOOK LLC, a portfolio company of Edison Innovation, ultimately owned by New Jersey Economic Development Authority, for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition strengthens Oracle Corp's cloud based software services, and also expands its customer base. Following the acquisition, LiveLOOK LLC's employees would join Oracle Corp. Until the transaction closes, both the companies would continue to operate independently. The deal is subject to regulatory approvals and other customary closing conditions. LiveLOOK LLC is located in Newark, New Jersey, United States and provides realtime online interaction tools.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: Datalogix Holdings, Inc. 
BUYER: Oracle Corp. 
SELLER: Datalogix Holdings, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: October 23, 2015 
ANNOUNCE DATE: December 22, 2014 
EFFECTIVE DATE: January 23, 2015



DEAL NO.: 812040


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

January 23, 2015

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired Datalogix Holdings Inc, a portfolio company of Costanoa Venture Capital Management LLC, Sequel Venture Partners LLC, Institutional Venture Partners, Breyer Capital LLC, General Catalyst LLC and Wellington Management Co LLP, for a reported value of US$1.2 billion. The acquisition allows Oracle Corp to expand its data cloud to maximize digital marketing services industry and also expands its customer base internationally. Following the acquisition, Datalogix Holdings Inc will become part of Oracle Corp's data cloud. Datalogix Holdings Inc is located in Westminster, Colorado, United States and provides database marketing and digital media solutions. Further, it employs around 375 people.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$1,200,000,000

Closing Offer Price:

$1,200,000,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$1,200,000,000

Total Invested Capital:

$1,200,000,000

Base Equity Price:

$1,200,000,000

Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

October 7, 2005

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired Innobase Oy for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition is expected to allow Oracle Corp to further expand its open-source database technology services. Innobase Oy is renowned for its InnoDB technology in which Oracle Corp plans to further develop.

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 14, 2005

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired the assets of TripleHop Technologies Inc for an undisclosed price. Oracle Corp will integrate the MatchPoint technology of TripleHop Technologies Inc into its search products. In addition, Oracle Corp is expected to retain certain members of the TripleHop Technologies Inc team.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

FOCUS - 26 of 146 DOCUMENTS


Copyright 2006 FactSet Mergerstat, LLC 
Mergerstat M & A Database



TARGET: i-flex Solutions Ltd. 
BUYER: Oracle Corp. 
SELLER: i-flex Solutions Ltd.



LAST UPDATE: September 13, 2006 
ANNOUNCE DATE: August 2, 2005 
EFFECTIVE DATE: December 6, 2005



DEAL NO.: 345076


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Tender Offer of a Minority Interest

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

December 6, 2005

Attitude:

Neutral

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp, a California based software company, acquired an additional 0.7% stake of i-flex Solutions Ltd from minority shareholders for approximately INR456.6 million (US$9.9 million) through a cash tender offer. Pursuant to Indian securities law, Oracle Corp was required to make an open offer to acquire an additional 20.8% stake, or 15,586,914 shares, in i-flex Solutions Ltd from the minority shareholders, which was valued at approximately INR13.7 billion (US$316 million). The buyer offered INR882.6 (US$20.3) cash per share; upon successful completion of the tender offer, Oracle would have increased its shareholding of i-flex Solutions Ltd to a 63.7% majority stake. The target is a Mumbai based software company that specializes in providing IT solutions to the financial services industry and vendors to over 540 customers in more than 110 countries. i-flex Solutions Ltd generated a net income of INR2 billion (US$46.8 million) in revenues for the fiscal year that ended on March 31, 2005. The acquisition allows Oracle Corp to enter the banking software business in India and reflects the company's willingness to enter new areas of the software sector, via acquisitions.

Transaction Notes:

BE = 517,375 shares * INR882.62 per share cash offer.

Premium Offered:

-0.029

Percent Owned Before:

42.410%

Percent Sought:

0.680%

Share Price:

$20.318

Original Offer Price:

$10,512,000

Closing Offer Price:

$10,512,000

Price/Earnings:

33.058

Multiple of Book Value:

6.507

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$10,512,069

Total Invested Capital:

$10,512,000

Base Equity Price:

$10,512,000


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

i-flex Solutions Ltd.

Country:

India

Exchange:

Description:

Develops custom software for the financial services industry

TARGET: Oracle Corp. /OnTarget Sales Methodology Div/ 
BUYER: Select Selling, Inc. 
SELLER: Oracle Corp.



LAST UPDATE: September 21, 2006 
ANNOUNCE DATE: July 10, 2006 
EFFECTIVE DATE: July 10, 2006



DEAL NO.: 381503


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 10, 2006

Deal Description:

Select Selling Inc acquired majority of the assets of Oracle Corp's OnTarget Sales Methodology division for an undisclosed price. The acquisition did not include France or Italy, and the OnTarget businesses in those countries will continue to operate as they did before the acquisition. The combined company will operates under a new name, The TAS Group Inc. The TAS Group, based in Kirkland, Washington, provides a complete range of sales methodologies and advanced tools and software solutions for businesses.

Percent Sought:

-1.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

Oracle Corp. /OnTarget Sales Methodology Div/

Country:

United States

Exchange:

NASDAQ

Industry:

Internet; Computer Software, Supplies & Services

Description:

Provides management software tools

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

August 5, 2005

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired the assets of Context Media Inc for an undisclosed price. This acquisition stems from the strategy of Oracle Corp to expand upon its product suite in the content-integration and rich media network. Oracle Corp is expected to retain the staff of Context Media Inc.

EFFECTIVE DATE: October 24, 2007



DEAL NO.: 444572


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

October 24, 2007

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired Interlace Systems Inc for an undisclosed amount. Interlace Systems Inc provides software that helps manufacturers make more confident operational decisions and improve operational performance in a constantly changing business environment. With Interlace Systems Inc, Oracle Corp will be able to enhance the financial planning and budgeting capabilities in its Hyperion Planning.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 18, 2007

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired Bharosa Inc for an undisclosed amount. Bharosa Inc is a provider of software that helps combat online identity theft and fraud. With the acquisition, Oracle Corp will uniquely provide the next generation of access management to customers and the market.

Not disclosed

Transaction Type:

DEAL NO.: 485119


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 31, 2008

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp, a developer of a diversified line of computer software products, acquired Global Knowledge Software LLC, a subsidiary of Global Knowledge Inc which is a private equity investment of Welsh Carson Anderson & Stowe, for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition allows Oracle Corp to offer a software package to clients that creates business process documentation, interactive system training, and just-in-time embedded support for all applications across their enterprise.

100.000%

Copyright 2009 FactSet Mergerstat, LLC 
Mergerstat M & A Database



TARGET: Siebel Systems, Inc. 
BUYER: Oracle Corp. 
SELLER: Siebel Systems, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: April 30, 2009 
ANNOUNCE DATE: September 12, 2005 
EFFECTIVE DATE: January 31, 2006



DEAL NO.: 349014


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

January 31, 2006

Source of Funds:

Cash, Vendor Placing

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp, a leading business software maker, acquired Siebel Systems Inc for $5.6 billion in cash and stock. Under the terms of the agreement, Siebel shareholders were to receive US$10.66 per share in cash for each Siebel share held, unless they elected to receive Oracle common stock, but no more than 30% of Siebel's common shares were to be exchanged for Oracle common stock. In the event that Siebel shareholders holding more than 30% of Siebel common stock elected to receive Oracle common stock, the equity consideration were to be pro-rated. At shareholders' meeting, 32.68% of Siebel shareholders elected to receive Oracle common stock. In accordance with the merger agreement, Siebel shareholders electing stock received approximately US$0.8752 in cash and 0.7888 shares of Oracle common stock for each Siebel share. The remaining Siebel shareholders received US$10.66 per share in cash. Siebel Systems Inc specialized customer programs are expected to synergize with Oracle Corps larger software suites. The two companies produce customer-service software which allows for businesses to better keep track of interaction with clients.

Transaction Notes:

BE = stock (pro-rated) ( cash (525,424,234 SEBL o/s * 32.68% * US$0.8752) + stock (525,424,234 SEBL o/s * 32.68% * 0.7888 exch ratio * US$12.61 ORCL closed 30-Jan-06)) + cash (525,424,234 SEBL o/s * 67.32% * US$10.66)

Equity Consideration:

$135,443,775

Premium Offered:

.283

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Share Price:

$10.660000

Original Offer Price:

$5,601,022,000

Closing Offer Price:

$5,628,834,000

Price/Earnings:

56.871

Multiple of Book Value:

2.936

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Combo

Cash Payment:

$3,920,715,634

Stock Payment:

$1,680,306,700

Total Invested Capital:

$5,647,029,000

Stock Exchange Ratio:

0.7888 : 1

Base Equity Price:

$5,601,022,334

Seller Breakup Fee:

$140,000,000

DEAL NO.: 504211


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 30, 2009

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired mValent Inc, a private equity investment of Charles River Ventures Inc, Flybridge Capital Partners and Polaris Venture Partners, for an undisclosed amount. The deal is expected to help Oracle Corp in their Enterprise Manager Software operations.

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

FOCUS - 42 of 146 DOCUMENTS


Copyright 2010 FactSet Mergerstat, LLC 
Mergerstat M & A Database



TARGET: eServGlobal Ltd. /Universal Services Platform Ops/ 
BUYER: Oracle Corp. 
SELLER: eServGlobal Ltd.



LAST UPDATE: September 30, 2010 
ANNOUNCE DATE: May 26, 2010 
EFFECTIVE DATE: August 4, 2010



DEAL NO.: 546707


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

August 4, 2010

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired the business and assets of the Universal Services Platform Operations of eServGlobal Ltd for up to AUD107 million (US$87.2 million). Under the terms of agreement, approximately 22% of the consideration will be held in escrow for two years with the first 50% released in the first year and the next 50% in the second year. In the event that the acquisition will not push through, eServGlobal Ltd has agreed to pay a break fee of AUD1.2 million (US$0.9 million). The acquisition provides an opportunity for Oracle Corp to expand its product and service portfolio. The transaction was subject to shareholder approval. The Universal Services Platform operations of eServGlobal Ltd provides software solutions to telecommunication customers. For the year ended June 30, 2009, it generated revenues of AUD61.6 million (US$50.2 million). On June 30, 2010, the shareholders of eServGlobal Ltd have approved the sale of the Universal Services Platform Operations of the company.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$94,394,000

Closing Offer Price:

$97,868,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$94,394,156

Total Invested Capital:

$94,394,000

Base Equity Price:

$94,394,156

DEAL NO.: 594658


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

September 1, 2011

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired InQuira Inc for an undisclosed amount. The transaction will strengthen the customer support services of InQuira Inc and Oracle Corp. Based in San Bruno, California, InQuira Inc provides software applications solutions and services. The acquisition was previously subject to customary closing conditions and regulatory approvals.

TARGET: Sun Microsystems, Inc. 
BUYER: Oracle Corp. 
SELLER: Sun Microsystems, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: February 7, 2012 
ANNOUNCE DATE: April 20, 2009 
EFFECTIVE DATE: January 27, 2010



DEAL NO.: 510696


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

January 27, 2010

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired Sun Microsystems Inc for approximately $7.1 billion in cash, or $9.50 per share. The transaction follows the failed attempts from IBM and Sun to complete their previously announced transaction. Oracle cited the Solaris technologies of Sun Microsystems Inc as a key attraction for doing the deal. In addition, Oracle Corp owns the MySQL database, which Sun had acquired in 2008.

Transaction Notes:

BE=744,705,385 JAVA o/s * $9.50 cash offer

.480

100.000%

-46.852

5.642

Available

Cash

$7,074,701,158

Total Invested Capital:

$8,331,701,000

Base Equity Price:

$7,074,701,158

$260,000,000

TARGET: Taleo Corp. 
BUYER: Oracle Corp. 
SELLER: Taleo Corp.



LAST UPDATE: April 17, 2012 
ANNOUNCE DATE: February 9, 2012 
EFFECTIVE DATE: April 5, 2012



DEAL NO.: 711303


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

April 5, 2012

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired Taleo Corp for US$1.9 billion in cash. Oracle Corp paid US$46 for each Taleo Corp share. The transaction creates a product capable of offering companies to manage their human resource operations and employee careers. The Board of Directors of Taleo Corp unanimously approved the transaction. Based in Dublin, California, Taleo Corp provides on-demand talent management software solutions.

Transaction Notes:

BE = US$46 per share * 41,496,136 target shares o/s as of November 2, 2012.

Premium Offered:

.241

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Share Price:

$46.000000

$1,908,822,000

$1,908,822,000

-109.507

24.890

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$1,908,822,256

Total Invested Capital:

$1,908,916,000

$1,908,822,256

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

September 2, 2007

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired Netsure Telecom Ltd for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition is expected to close within 30-days of the announce date. Netsure Telecom Ltd provides network intelligence, analytics and network data integrity software services. The acquisition broadens Oracle Corp's product portfolio by helping clients make better use of its networks.

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Purpose:

Horizontal

May 20, 2010

Deal Description:

The acquisition expands the product portfolio of Oracle Corp. The transaction was originally expected to be completed before the end of June 2010. Secerno Ltd provides database security solutions.

DEAL NO.: 721398


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

May 23, 2012

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired Vitrue Inc for an undisclosed amount. The deal value is reported to be US$300 million. Oracle Corp intends to combine its data management and analytics capabilities with Vitrue's Software-as-a-service marketing applications to create a comprehensive social relationship platform for its clients. Vitrue Inc is based in Atlanta, Georgia, United States, and provides online brand marketing services. The transaction was originally expected to close in the summer of 2012.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Closing Offer Price:

$300,000,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

$300,000,000

$300,000,000

DEAL NO.: 505297


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

November 3, 2008

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired the intellectual property assets of Tacit Software Inc for an undisclosed price. Oracle Corp will hire all the software engineers of Tacit Software Inc, which produces an automated profiling technology that helps organizations uncover new opportunities for collaboration. Tacit Software Inc is venture backed by Draper Fisher Jurvetson, Woodside Fund, Alta Partners, In-Q-Tel, RBC Technology Ventures, a subsidiary of the Royal Bank of Canada; and Reuters Venture Capital, the in-house venture capital arm of the Reuters Group.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Deal Description:

Before closing of the transaction, Blue Kai Inc will continue to operate as an independent entity. The transaction is subject to regulatory approval and other customary closing conditions. Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Deal Description:

The acquisition will compliment Oracle Corp with engineered storage solutions and will lead to creation of a comprehensive enterprise grade cloud solution. The transaction is subject to certain customary closing conditions. Front Porch Digital Inc is located in Louisville, Colorado, United States and provides digital archive management and transcending solutions.

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp has signed an agreement to acquire AddThis Inc, a portfolio company of Rho Ventures, Amidzad LLC, ZG Ventures LLC, Novak Biddle Venture Partners, Revolution Ventures, Idea Foundry, New Enterprise Associates LLC and Institutional Venture Partners, for an undisclosed amount. The transaction enhances Oracle Corp's portfolio of software solutions. AddThis Inc is located in Vienna, Virginia, United States and provides social sharing and analytics solutions.

DEAL NO.: 852618


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

December 18, 2015

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired StackEngine Inc, a portfolio company of LiveOak Venture Partners and Silverton Partners, for an undisclosed amount. This acquisition would enhance the cloud based application solutions of Oracle Corp. StackEngine Inc is located in Austin, Texas, United States and builds software to manage and automate docker applications.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: Tangosol, Inc. 
BUYER: Oracle Corp. 
SELLER: Tangosol, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: April 23, 2007 
ANNOUNCE DATE: March 23, 2007 
EFFECTIVE DATE: April 20, 2007



DEAL NO.: 415541


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

April 20, 2007

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired Tangosol, Inc. for an undisclosed amount. Tangosol, Inc. is a provider of reliable in-memory data grid software. Data grid software increases application performance by providing fast, distributed access to frequently used data. The acquisition expands Oracle Corp's product line and increases the company's market niche in the middleware for buildings sector.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

Tangosol, Inc.

Country:

United States

Description:

Providers in-memory data grid software

DEAL NO.: 438102


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

September 5, 2007

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired Bridgestream Inc for an undisclosed amount. According to Oracle Corp the acquisition will help enable the next generation of integration between security and business process controls by delivering a closed-loop solution that combines role discovery, modeling, enforcement, attestation and audit in a single integrated solution. Oracle will integrate Bridgestream Inc into Oracles Fusion Middleware.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

DEAL NO.: 419415


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

May 31, 2007

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired Lodestar Corp for an undisclosed amount. Lodestar Corp, headquartered in Peabody, Massachusetts, provides meter data management software products for the utilities industry. The combined synergies of the two companies will allow Oracle to deliver a comprehensive suite of mission critical operational systems for the utilities industry.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: Net4call AS 
BUYER: Oracle Corp. 
SELLER: Net4call AS



LAST UPDATE: May 2, 2008 
ANNOUNCE DATE: April 19, 2006 
EFFECTIVE DATE: April 19, 2006



DEAL NO.: 371772


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

April 19, 2006

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired Net4call AS for an undisclosed price. Net4Call is a six-year-old Oslo-based operation, with 12 employees and sales of more than EUR1 million (US$1.2 million). Net4Call is Oracle's third purchase this year of a software maker that focuses on telecommunications.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

Net4call AS

Country:

Norway

Industry:

Telecommunications; Computer Software, Supplies & Services

Description:

Provides software focusing on telecommunications

EFFECTIVE DATE: March 28, 2008



DEAL NO.: 442129


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of non-US (foreign) company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 28, 2008

Deal Description:

i-flex Solutions Ltd, a unit of Oracle Corp, acquired the remaining 40.1% stake in Castek Software Inc for an undisclosed price. i-flex Solutions Ltd acquired a 34% minority stake in May 2005, and increased its stake to 59.9% in an equity financing arrangement in August 2005.

Percent Owned Before:

59.900%

Percent Sought:

40.100%

Terms:

Not disclosed

LAST UPDATE: May 2, 2008 
ANNOUNCE DATE: January 16, 2008 
EFFECTIVE DATE: February 22, 2008



DEAL NO.: 456582


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

February 22, 2008

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired Captovation Inc, a company that allows critical content capture from within business application and process, for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition will allow Oracle to be the only vendor that can provide customers with fully integrated solutions for automating back office operations.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: Empirix, Inc. /Web Application Testing Business/ 
BUYER: Oracle Corp. 
SELLER: Empirix, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: October 10, 2008 
ANNOUNCE DATE: March 27, 2008 
EFFECTIVE DATE: March 27, 2008



DEAL NO.: 466898


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 27, 2008

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp, the world's largest enterprise software company, acquired the Web testing software of Empirix Inc, for an undisclosed amount. Empirix Inc's e-TEST suite is a set of Web application testing solutions that help customers deploy higher quality applications more efficiently and at lower cost. The e-TEST suite products will be incorporated into Oracle Enterprise Manager and Oracle Real Application Testing, and the combination is expected to result in a comprehensive solution for testing packaged and custom-built applications.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

Empirix, Inc. /Web Application Testing Business/

Country:

United States

Industry:

Internet; Computer Software, Supplies & Services

Description:

Provides software testing solutions

TARGET: Virtual Iron Software, Inc. 
BUYER: Oracle Corp. 
SELLER: Virtual Iron Software, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: May 13, 2009 
ANNOUNCE DATE: May 13, 2009



DEAL NO.: 512628


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp agreed to acquire Virtual Iron Software Inc for an undisclosed amount. Virtual Iron Software Inc is a provider of server virtualization management software that enables dynamic resource and capacity management in virtualized data centers. Brookside Capital Partners Management LLC, Goldman Sachs Capital Partners, Highland Capital Partners Inc and Kepha Partners are private equity investors of Virtual Iron Software Inc.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: HyperRoll, Inc. 
BUYER: Oracle Corp. 
SELLER: HyperRoll, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: September 30, 2009 
ANNOUNCE DATE: September 29, 2009 
EFFECTIVE DATE: September 29, 2009



DEAL NO.: 524276


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

September 29, 2009

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired the assets of HyperRoll Inc for an undisclosed price. HyperRoll Inc has developed a financial reporting acceleration solutions with interactive reporting capability to support complex data calculation requirements. The employees of the company are expected to join the staff at Oracle. HyperRoll has raised over $26 million in VC funding between 2000 and 2004, from firms like Bessemer Venture Partners, Denali Venture Capital, Greylock Partners, Lighthouse Capital Partners, Vertex Managementand Sequoia Capital.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

TARGET: Silver Creek Systems, Inc. 
BUYER: Oracle Corp. 
SELLER: Silver Creek Systems, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: January 5, 2010 
ANNOUNCE DATE: January 4, 2010 
EFFECTIVE DATE: January 4, 2010



DEAL NO.: 532141


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

January 4, 2010

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired Silver Creek Systems Inc for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition will enhance Oracle's product data quality across enterprise applications. It also complements Oracle's Information Management offerings and will extend its leadership in data integration with advanced data quality capabilities to manage product data across multiple industries. Silver Creek Systems Inc provides product data quality solutions.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

TARGET: Portal Software, Inc. 
BUYER: Oracle Corp. 
SELLER: Portal Software, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: April 29, 2010 
ANNOUNCE DATE: April 12, 2006 
EFFECTIVE DATE: July 3, 2006



DEAL NO.: 371046


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition Tender Offer

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 3, 2006

Attitude:

Friendly

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp, an enterprise software company, acquired Portal Software Inc through a cash tender offer for approximately $211.7 million at $4.90 per share. Portal Software provides global billing and revenue management solutions for the communications and media industry. According to Oracle's President Charles Phillips, the combination is expected to deliver the first end-to-end packaged enterprise software suite for the communications industry. Oracle supplies technology and applications to over 90% of the communications companies worldwide. Oracle expects that the addition of Portal Software's billing capacity to be a logical and complementary addition to its existing services.

Transaction Notes:

BE= 43,195,525 PRSF.PK o/s * $4.90 cash

Premium Offered:

.161

Percent Sought:

100.000%

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

January 5, 2011

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired Art Technology Group Inc for US$948.7 million in cash. Under the terms of the agreement, Oracle acquired Art Technology shares for US$6 cash per share. The acquisition will enable Oracle to provide next-generation, unified cross-channel commerce and CRM which is part of Oracle's strategy. Based in Cambridge, Massachusetts, Art Technology Group Inc provides an integrated suite of Internet customer relationship management and e-commerce software.

LAST UPDATE: June 7, 2011 
ANNOUNCE DATE: April 16, 2010 
EFFECTIVE DATE: August 11, 2010



DEAL NO.: 542302


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

August 11, 2010

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired Phase Forward Inc for US$744.6 million in cash. Under the terms of agreement, Oracle paid US$17.00 in cash per outstanding share of Phase Forward. The purchase price is a 30% premium on the close price of Phase Forward Inc ending April 15, 2010. The acquisition of Phase Forward is part of Oracle's strategy in providing critical software solutions for key industries. Phase Forward Inc, located in Massachusetts, develops software solutions for the pharmaceutical industries.

Transaction Notes:

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

November 26, 2001

Deal Description:

SAIC Ltd, a subsidiary of Science Applications International Corp, San Diego, California, US, acquired the Energy Downstream software division of Oracle Corp, Redwood City, California, US, computer software develop. The division acquired provides software solutions and support for customers in the energy downstream sector. Terms not disclosed.

DEAL NO.: 124719


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Unit Minority

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 1, 2000

Deal Description:

J Sainsbury PLC, London, England, the food and home improvement goods retail group, acquired a 5% stake in GlobalNetXchange, an online business-to-business exchange joint venture between Carrefour, Paris, Ile-de-France, France, supermarket operator, Sears, Roebuck & Co, Hoffman Estates, Illinois, USA, retailer of apparel, home and automotive products and services through e-commerce channels, and Oracle Corporation, Redwood Shores, California, USA, the software and Internet group. Consideration US$15m (GB£9.46m). At the same time, Metro AG, the German supermarket group, also acquired a 5% stake.

TARGET: i-flex Solutions Ltd. 
BUYER: Oracle Corp. 
SELLER: i-flex Solutions Ltd.



LAST UPDATE: May 29, 2012 
ANNOUNCE DATE: August 2, 2005 
EFFECTIVE DATE: November 24, 2005



DEAL NO.: 345069


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture Minority Interest

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

November 24, 2005

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp, a California based software company, acquired a 42.8% minority stake of i-flex Solutions Ltd from Citigroup Venture Capital International, the private equity arm of Citigroup Inc, for approximately INR25.8 billion (US$593 million). The target is a Mumbai based software company that specializes in providing IT solutions to the financial services industry; the company vendors to over 540 customers in more than 110 countries. i-flex generated a net income of INR2 billion (US$46.8 million) on revenues of INR11.4 billion (US$262.5 million) for the fiscal year that ended on March 31, 2005. The acquisition, which will allow Oracle to enter the banking software business, reflects the company's willingness to enter new areas of the software sector, via acquisitions. In a related transaction, Oracle will be required by Indian securities law to make an open offer for i-flex to minority shareholders.

Premium Offered:

-.120

Percent Sought:

42.800%

Share Price:

$18.416157

Original Offer Price:

$593,663,000

Closing Offer Price:

$564,305,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$593,663,244

Total Invested Capital:

$593,663,000

Base Equity Price:

$593,663,244

Name:

i-flex Solutions Ltd.

Country:

India

Industry:

Internet; Computer Software, Supplies & Services

Description:

Develops custom software for the financial services industry

TARGET: Eloqua, Inc. 
BUYER: Oracle Corp. 
SELLER: Eloqua, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: April 16, 2013 
ANNOUNCE DATE: December 20, 2012 
EFFECTIVE DATE: February 8, 2013



DEAL NO.: 742360


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

February 8, 2013

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired Eloqua Inc for US$809.9 million, in cash, or US$23.5 per share. The acquisition would create an enhanced customer experience cloud offering of the bidder. Based in Vienna, Eloqua Inc provides on-demand revenue performance management software solutions. The deal was subject to customary closing conditions including shareholder and regulatory approvals. The acquisition was unanimously approved by the Board of Directors of Eloqua Inc. The transaction was expected to close in the first half of 2013.

Transaction Notes:

BE = US$23.5 per share * 34,460,636 target shares o/s as of October 31, 2012.

Premium Offered:

.325

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Share Price:

$23.500000

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Deal Description:

Located in Providence, Rhode Island, United States, GreenBytes Inc develops desktop virtualization storage optimization software. TARGET: Dyna Image Corp. 
BUYER: Dialog Semiconductor PLC 
SELLER: Oracle Corp.



LAST UPDATE: February 3, 2016 
ANNOUNCE DATE: May 6, 2015 
EFFECTIVE DATE: May 6, 2015



DEAL NO.: 826189


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Unit Minority

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

May 6, 2015

Deal Description:

Dialog Semiconductor Plc acquired a 40% minority stake in Dyna Image Corp from LSC Inc, a subsidiary of Oracle Corp for an undisclosed amount. The acquisition would strengthen Dialog Semiconductor Plc's portfolio of product offerings. As part of the transaction, Dialog Semiconductor Plc's CEO, Jalal Bagherli, along with Senior Vice President of Corporate Development, Mark Tyndall, would join the board of Dyna Image Corp. Dyna Image Corp is located in Taipei, Taiwan and designs, develops and market customized sensors. The deal was originally expected to close by June 30, 2015.

Percent Sought:

40.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

Designs, develops and market customized sensors

TARGET: SiteWorks Solutions 
BUYER: Oracle Corp. 
SELLER: SiteWorks Solutions



LAST UPDATE: January 22, 2004 
ANNOUNCE DATE: January 22, 2004 
EFFECTIVE DATE: January 22, 2004



DEAL NO.: 251818


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company - Assets Acquired

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

January 22, 2004

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired the assets and business operations of SiteWorks Solutions for an undisclosed amount. SiteWorks Solutions provides clinical trial management software products used by hospitals, pharmaceutical companies, and research institutions to manage clinical trials. Upon completion of the deal, the integrated suite will help research institutions operate more efficiently and help pharmaceutical companies bring new drugs to the market more quickly.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

Name:

SiteWorks Solutions

Country:

United States

Industry:

Healthcare; Computer Software, Supplies & Services

Description:

Supplies clinical trial management software products to the healthcare industry

TARGET: E Travel, Inc. 
BUYER: Telefónica SA / Amadeus Global Travel Distribution SA 
SELLER: Oracle Corp.



LAST UPDATE: April 7, 2004 
ANNOUNCE DATE: July 30, 2001 
EFFECTIVE DATE: July 30, 2001



DEAL NO.: 149086


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

July 30, 2001

Deal Description:

Amadeus Global Travel Distribution SA, a subsidiary of Telefonica SA, acquired E-Travel Inc from Oracle Corp for an undisclosed amount. This acquisition leaves Amadeus with a larger global footprint than any competing corporate travel management provider. It allows the company to offer eTravel products in addition to its corporate traveler and management applications for Lotus and SAP corporate users

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

January 2, 1997

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Transaction Notes:

Including the 13.4 % already owned by Oracle, Datalogixs valuation is $94 M or 2x trailing 12 months revs.

Mergerstat M & A Database



TARGET: Oblix, Inc. 
BUYER: Oracle Corp. 
SELLER: Oblix, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: October 11, 2005 
ANNOUNCE DATE: March 28, 2005 
EFFECTIVE DATE: March 28, 2005



DEAL NO.: 332270


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

March 28, 2005

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp, the largest provider of enterprise software solutions, acquired Oblix Inc, a provider of identity management software solutions, for an undisclosed price. The acquisition will enable Oracle to offer customers a complete solution for securely managing identities with greater flexibility which will help customers lower the cost of regulatory compliance. Oblix Inc, founded in 1996 and headquartered in Cupertino, California, is a leading provider of identity management software that allows web access control.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * TARGET DETAILS * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

DEAL NO.: 339727


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

June 20, 2005

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp acquired TimesTen Inc, a privately held supplier of real-time data management software, for an undisclosed price. TimesTen provides infrastructure software for managing events, transactions and data for a growing number of performance-critical applications in telecom, networking, securities trading and other industries. Systems powered by TimesTen today include real-time billing, stock trading, call centers, airline operations and many other ultra high-performance applications.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Terms:

Not disclosed

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

October 9, 2006

Deal Description:

Oracle Corp, a database software supplier, acquired Sunopsis for undisclosed terms. Sunopsis is a data integration software maker. Oracle intends to incorporate Sunopsis' technology into its Fusion middleware line and make it an integral part of it service-oriented architecture, business intelligence and master data management products.

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

TARGET: The Capital Markets Co. Pte Ltd.

SELLER: The Capital Markets Co. NV



LAST UPDATE: March 18, 2008 
ANNOUNCE DATE: January 3, 2007 
EFFECTIVE DATE: January 3, 2007



DEAL NO.: 405389


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Divestiture

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

January 3, 2007

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

i-flex Solutions Pte Ltd, a subsidiary of i-flex Solutions Ltd , acquired The Capital Markets Co Pte Ltd from The Capital Markets Co NV for SGD1.6 million ($1US.1 million) in cash. Capital Markets Co develops and supplies financial services software solutions. The acquisition will strengthen i-flex Consulting's ability to provide high-end consulting to banks in the Asia Pacific region. The combined i-flex-CAPCO team provides a compelling pool of expertise to assist banks in business transformation, management of large technology implementations and addressing risk and compliance requirements.

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Original Offer Price:

$1,050,000

Closing Offer Price:

$1,050,000

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$1,049,999

Total Invested Capital:

$1,050,000

Base Equity Price:

$1,050,000

Name:

The Capital Markets Co. Pte Ltd.

Country:

Singapore

Industry:

Internet; Brokerage, Investment & Management Consultancy

Description:

Develops and supplies financial services software solutions

DEAL NO.: 459086


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Divestiture

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

February 11, 2008

Deal Description:

SDL Plc acquired Idiom Technologies Inc for US$27.7 million and the assumption of US$4.9 million in debt and working capital. Idiom Technologies Inc is a developer of software that helps simplify complex globalization efforts. The acquisition strengthens SDL Plc's position as a provider of global information management solutions.

Purpose:

December 15, 1998

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Private Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

November 19, 2001

Source of Funds:

Cash, Vendor Placing

Deal Description:

J.D. Edwards & Co acquired YOUcentric for $92.6 million in cash and stock. This acquisition will add the technology solutions to develop customer relationship management software, including applications for sales force automation, campaign management, contact center management, and partner relationship management. Through this acquisition J.D. Edwards & Co will deliver a comprehensive set of integrated collaborative applications that enable companies to electronically manage their business relationships.

FOCUS - 144 of 146 DOCUMENTS


Copyright 2014 FactSet Mergerstat, LLC 
Mergerstat M & A Database



TARGET: Dell Software, Inc. 
BUYER: Dell, Inc. 
SELLER: Dell Software, Inc.



LAST UPDATE: August 21, 2014 
ANNOUNCE DATE: July 2, 2012 
EFFECTIVE DATE: September 28, 2012



DEAL NO.: 721673


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

September 28, 2012

Attitude:

Friendly

Source of Funds:

Cash

Deal Description:

Dell Inc acquired Quest Software Inc for US$2.4 billion in cash. Dell Inc agreed to pay US$28 cash per share. The acquisition was approved by the Board of Directors of both companies. On May 25, 2012, Quest Software Inc was rumored to have received an offer to be acquired for US$2.3 billion in cash. The rumored bidder offered to pay US$25.50 in cash per Quest Software Inc share. Further, the Board of Directors of Quest Software Inc determined that the offer was superior to the proposal of Insight Venture Partners. Dell Inc, International Business Machines Corp, CA Inc, BMC Software Inc and Oracle Corp were among the interested bidders to acquire Quest Software Inc. On June 25, 2012, Quest Software Inc announced that it had received a higher bid of US$27.50 for each of its outstanding shares from Dell Inc, valuing the group at about US$2.3 billion. The transaction was subject to shareholder approval and originally expected to close during the third fiscal quarter of Dell Inc. Established in 1987 and based in Aliso Viejo, California, Quest Software Inc designs, develops, markets, distributes, and supports enterprise systems management software products. On July 23, 2012, the merger received approval from the US Federal Trade Commission. On September 25, 2012, Quest Software Inc announced that the shareholders of Quest Software approved the acquisition of Quest by Dell Inc. Quest Software Inc intends to delist from NASDAQ upon completion.

Transaction Notes:

BE = US$28 cash per share * 84,812,521 shares outstanding as of 26 July 2012

Premium Offered:

.402

Percent Sought:

100.000%

Share Price:

$28.000000

Original Offer Price:

$2,162,719,000

Closing Offer Price:

$2,374,751,000

Price/Earnings:

448.574

Multiple of Book Value:

-18.021

Terms:

Available

Method of Payment:

Cash

Cash Payment:

$2,374,750,588

Total Invested Capital:

$2,478,804,000

Base Equity Price:

$2,374,750,588

Dell Software, Inc.

Description:

Designs, develops, markets, distributes, and supports enterprise systems management software products

TARGET: Scopus Technology Inc

LAST UPDATE: February 17, 2008 
ANNOUNCE DATE: March 2, 1998 
EFFECTIVE DATE: May 19, 1998



DEAL NO.: 28487


* * * * * * * * * * * * * * TRANSACTION SUMMARY * * * * * * * * * * * * * *


Deal Type:

Acquisition

Transaction Type:

Acquisition of Public Company

Purpose:

Horizontal

Closing Date:

May 19, 1998

Source of Funds:

Vendor Placing

Deal Description:

Siebel Systems acquired Scopus Technology in a pooling of interests transaction. Siebel exchanged 0.7281 of its shares for each Scopus share and will issue 2.6 million shares for the assumption of employee stock options.

Transaction Notes:

Filings: S-4 3/98 - TS. BE=20,745,709 * 0.7281 * $25.25 05/18 SEBL close. (Src Fix-It: Combo)
